item.title: Sears and O'Rourke included in New Zealand's Champions Trophy squad - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
New Zealand Announces Champions Trophy Squad Including Sears and O'Rourke

Date: February 7, 2023 Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Fast bowlers Ben Sears and Will O'Rourke have been named in New Zealand's squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy, reflecting the team's strategy to include versatile and dynamic players.

  • Ben Sears, returning from injury, may make his ODI debut.
  • Will O'Rourke has showcased impressive skills early in his international career.
  • Nathan Smith brings added strength and utility as an allrounder.
  • Head coach Gary Stead emphasizes the importance of Sears' pace in Pakistan's conditions.
“We've been a little conservative in Ben's return to play, but we always had an eye that we thought he would be part of this Champions Trophy squad,” said Gary Stead.

Inclusion of Sears and O'Rourke means Jacob Duffy will not be part of the main squad despite his recent performances.

The final squad will play in an ODI tri-series in Pakistan before the Champions Trophy, beginning with matches against Pakistan and South Africa.

item.title: BCCI Confirms Starting Date For IPL 2025 - Everything You Need To Know - NDTV Sports
item.description:
IPL 2025 Begins on March 23, Confirms BCCI

Publication Date: Sunday

Source: Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI)

The 18th season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) will officially start on March 23, 2025, as confirmed by BCCI Vice President Rajeev Shukla. The announcement comes after all 10 franchises have chosen their squads during the mega auction held in November 2024.

  • IPL 2025 kick-off confirmed for March 23.
  • Last season started on March 22, 2024, concluding on May 26.
  • Kolkata Knight Riders are the defending champions.
  • Venues for the Women’s Premier League (WPL) will be announced soon.
  • All franchises have finalized their squads during the mega auction.
“IPL is going to start from March 23.” - Rajeev Shukla

With the excitement building up for the upcoming season, fans are eagerly looking forward to the matches and performances from their favorite teams.

item.title: Australian Open 2025: Sumit Nagal’s campaign ends in first round, Indian tennis star loses to world No. 25 Tomas Machac - Mint
item.description:
Sumit Nagal Eliminated in First Round of Australian Open 2025 by Tomas Machac

Publication Date: Sunday
Source: Live Mint

Sumit Nagal's journey at the Australian Open 2025 concluded in the first round, where he faced world No. 25 Tomas Machac and lost in straight sets.

  • Nagal lost to Machac with scores of 3-6, 1-6, 5-7.
  • Despite an early strong performance, Nagal struggled with errors and could not capitalize on his chances.
  • The match showcased Nagal's inconsistency, particularly during crucial moments.
  • This marks the end of India's singles campaign at the tournament, although Indian players continue in the doubles event.
  • Last year, Nagal made headlines by reaching the main draw and eliminating a higher-ranked opponent in the first round.
“Last year, Nagal made headlines by reaching the Australian Open main draw through the qualifiers and stunning higher-ranked Alexander Bublik in the first round before bowing out in the second.”

The early exit against Machac highlights the challenges faced by Indian players in the singles category at this year's tournament.

item.title: "Not Doing Any PR": Ex India Star Fumes Over Rishabh Pant's Omission From T20I Squad - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Not Doing Any PR: Ex India Star Fumes Over Rishabh Pant's Omission From T20I Squad

Publication Date: November 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Former cricketer Aakash Chopra expresses disappointment over Rishabh Pant's absence from India's T20I squad against England, highlighting the selection of younger players.

  • Rishabh Pant, Shubman Gill, and Yashasvi Jaiswal were not selected for the T20I series.
  • Aakash Chopra criticizes the preference for Dhruv Jurel over Pant as a wicket-keeper choice.
  • Chopra believes Pant is a generational talent and urges the BCCI to invest in his future.
  • He questions the clarity of selectors regarding Pant's position in the team.
“It can't be that Rishabh Pant is not in your scheme of things. So early in his career, have you taken this call?” - Aakash Chopra

Chopra calls for more transparency from selectors regarding player selections, especially during transition phases.

item.title: Every ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025 squad - ICC Cricket
item.description:
ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025 Squads Announced

Publication Date: February 2025
Source: ICC Cricket

The ICC Champions Trophy 2025 marks the tournament's return after an eight-year hiatus, hosted by Pakistan. The competition will feature eight teams divided into two groups, each vying for the title.

Key Points:

  • The tournament begins on February 19th with Pakistan facing New Zealand.
  • Group A includes Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, and New Zealand.
  • Group B consists of Afghanistan, England, Australia, and South Africa.
  • Each team will play three matches with the top two from each group advancing to the semi-finals.

Squads:

Group A:

India: To be announced

Bangladesh: Nazmul Hossain Shanto (c), Soumya Sarkar, Tanzid Hasan, Tawhid Hridoy, Mushfiqur Rahim, MD Mahmud Ullah, Jaker Ali Anik, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Rishad Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman, Parvez Hossai Emon, Nasum Ahmed, Tanzim Hasan Sakib, Nahid Rana

New Zealand: Mitchell Santner (c), Michael Bracewell, Mark Chapman, Devon Conway, Lockie Ferguson, Matt Henry, Tom Latham, Daryl Mitchell, Will O’Rourke, Glenn Phillips, Rachin Ravindra, Ben Sears, Nathan Smith, Kane Williamson, Will Young

Pakistan: To be announced

Group B:

Afghanistan: Hashmatullah Shahidi (c), Ibrahim Zadran, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Sediqullah Atal, Rahmat Shah, Ikram Alikhil, Gulbadin Naib, Azmatullah Omarzai, Mohammad Nabi, Rashid Khan, AM Ghazanfar, Noor Ahmad, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Farid Malik, Naveed Zadran

England: Jos Buttler (c), Jofra Archer, Gus Atkinson, Jacob Bethell, Harry Brook, Brydon Carse, Ben Duckett, Jamie Overton, Jamie Smith, Liam Livingstone, Adil Rashid, Joe Root, Saqib Mahmood, Phil Salt, Mark Wood

Australia: To be announced

South Africa: To be announced

item.title: IND-W vs IRE-W: Jemimah Rodrigues’ maiden ODI hundred powers India women to reach 370-run mark for 1st time in 47 years - Mint
item.description:
IND-W vs IRE-W: Jemimah Rodrigues’ maiden ODI hundred powers India women to reach 370-run mark for 1st time in 47 years

Publication Date: Unknown, Source: Live Mint

Jemimah Rodrigues scored her maiden ODI hundred, helping the India women's cricket team reach a historic total of 370 runs against Ireland, the highest in their ODI history.

  • India posted 370/5 in 50 overs during the second ODI against Ireland.
  • Captain Smriti Mandhana scored 73 runs, while Jemimah Rodrigues made 102 runs off 91 balls.
  • Other notable contributions included 67 runs from newcomer Pratika Rawal and 89 from Harleen Deol.
  • India's previous highest total in ODIs was 358/2, recorded against Ireland in 2017.
  • The innings featured 44 boundaries and three sixes, demonstrating the team's aggressive batting approach.
  • This match marks India's first ODI played since 1978.
“It was an overwhelming moment for me, and I am grateful for the support I received from my teammates.” - Jemimah Rodrigues

India leads the series 1-0 after winning their opening ODI by six wickets.

item.title: Litton and Shakib left out of Bangladesh's Champions Trophy squad - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Litton Das and Shakib Al Hasan Excluded from Bangladesh's Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Bangladesh has decided to leave wicketkeeper-batter Litton Das out of their squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy tournament, marking a significant decision following his recent poor performance in ODIs. Shakib Al Hasan is also not included due to suspension from bowling.

  • Litton Das has not scored a half-century in his last 13 ODI innings.
  • Shakib's exclusion is tied to his suspension due to an illegal bowling action.
  • Other players omitted from the squad include Afif Hossain, Shoriful Islam, and Hasan Mahmud.
  • Captain Najmul Hossain Shanto returns to the squad after recovering from a hamstring injury.
“Litton is out of form. He is getting out in a similar pattern... Opposition analysts are getting too successful against Litton,” said Gazi Ashraf Hossain, chief selector.

Bangladesh aims to rely on in-form players to seize opportunities during the tournament.

item.title: "If Yuvraj Singh Had Died And India Won The World Cup, I Would've Been Proud": Father Yograj Singh - NDTV Sports
item.description:
If Yuvraj Singh Had Died And India Won The World Cup, I Would've Been Proud: Father Yograj Singh

Publication Date: January 12, 2025

Source: NDTV

Yograj Singh expressed immense pride in his son Yuvraj Singh's contributions to Indian cricket, especially during India's World Cup victories.

  • Yuvraj Singh battled cancer and played a key role in India's 2011 World Cup win, earning Player of the Series.
  • Yograj stated that he would have been proud even if Yuvraj had died winning the World Cup for India.
  • Yograj believes Yuvraj did not fully realize his potential as a cricketer.
  • Yuvraj scored 362 runs at an average of 90.50 during the 2011 World Cup, playing a crucial role in India's success.
"For our country, if Yuvraj Singh had died from cancer and had won India the World Cup, I would have been a proud father," said Yograj Singh.

The father's reflections highlight the deep emotional connection and pride associated with Yuvraj Singh's career and achievements in cricket.

item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025 Full Squads: List Of Teams And Players Confirmed So Far - News18
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025 Full Squads: List Of Teams And Players Confirmed So Far

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: News18

The ICC Champions Trophy returns in 2025 after an eight-year hiatus, featuring eight teams competing in a Hybrid Model in Pakistan and the UAE. This marks the beginning of an exciting tournament filled with top cricketing talent.

  • The tournament kicks off on February 19, 2025, with Pakistan facing New Zealand.
  • India will start against Bangladesh on February 20 in Dubai.
  • Full squads must be submitted to the ICC by January 12, 2025, although final changes can be made until February 12.
  • The final match is scheduled for March 9, 2025.
  • Confirmed teams include India, Pakistan, Australia, England, New Zealand, South Africa, Afghanistan, and Bangladesh.
“Champions Trophy aka the ‘mini world cup’ is set to make its return after a gap of nearly eight years.”

This eagerly awaited tournament promises thrilling matches with some of the world’s best players competing for the title.

item.title: Watch: Ruturaj Gaikwad Castled As Arshdeep Turns Wasim Akram With A Magic Ball - OneCricket
item.description:
Arshdeep Singh Dismisses Ruturaj Gaikwad with Stunning Delivery in VHT Quarterfinal

Publication Date: Not specified Source: One Cricket News

In the quarterfinals of the Vijay Hazare Trophy, India’s fast bowler Arshdeep Singh made an impressive start by taking out Maharashtra captain Ruturaj Gaikwad with a remarkable delivery during the first over of the innings.

  • Arshdeep dismissed Gaikwad with a sharp delivery that uprooted his off stump.
  • Punjab opted to bowl first after winning the toss, and Arshdeep capitalized on this decision.
  • After dismissing Gaikwad, Arshdeep also took the wicket of Siddhesh Veer for a duck.
  • Maharashtra was at 35 for two after ten overs with Kulkarni and Bawne at the crease.
“The left-arm pacer angled it away from Gaikwad, completely beating him.”

Arshdeep's performance is pivotal as Punjab looks to advance in the tournament, showcasing the impact of a strong bowling attack early in the match.

item.title: 1st Time In 48 Years: Jemimah Rodrigues Inspires India Women To Historic ODI Feat - NDTV Sports
item.description:
1st Time In 48 Years: Jemimah Rodrigues Inspires India Women To Historic ODI Feat

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

Jemimah Rodrigues made history with her maiden ODI century, leading India Women to a record total of 370 runs against Ireland, marking a significant milestone in their 48-year ODI history.

  • Jemimah Rodrigues scored 102 runs off 91 balls.
  • Smriti Mandhana contributed 73 runs off 54 balls.
  • Patika Rawal and Harleen Deol also made significant contributions with 67 and 89 runs respectively.
  • This match saw India Women reaching 370 runs for the first time in their ODI history.
  • The team achieved the total based on strong partnerships, particularly a 183-run stand between Rodrigues and Deol.
  • Indian batters hit 44 boundaries and three sixes throughout the innings.
"It has been a long wait to get this hundred. Glad that the team gave me a role at No. 4 and I could deliver," - Jemimah Rodrigues

This remarkable performance by Jemimah Rodrigues and her team not only highlights their batting prowess but also sets a new benchmark for women's cricket in India, paving the way for future successes.

item.title: Vinod Kambli touches Sunil Gavaskar’s feet, meets Prithvi Shaw during Wankhede Stadium’s 50th anniversary event - Mint
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Touches Sunil Gavaskar’s Feet at Wankhede Stadium’s 50th Anniversary

Publication Date: January 1, 2023 | Source: LiveMint

Vinod Kambli paid homage to cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar during the 50th anniversary celebrations of Wankhede Stadium, marking the occasion with heartfelt moments alongside cricketer Prithvi Shaw.

  • Kambli, recently hospitalized, greeted Gavaskar by touching his feet, showing respect and admiration.
  • Gavaskar embraced Kambli warmly, highlighting their strong connection.
  • Other cricket legends including Sachin Tendulkar and Rohit Sharma are set to participate in the grand celebrations scheduled for January 19.
  • Gavaskar expressed his gratitude toward the Mumbai Cricket Association for their support throughout his career.
  • Kambli reflected on his memorable achievements at Wankhede, urging aspiring cricketers to work hard.
  • Prithvi Shaw, facing criticism lately, is focusing on improving his fitness.
“It is indeed a very big honour for me to be here at this iconic venue that has given Indian cricket so much.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The event highlights the rich history of Wankhede Stadium and emphasizes the importance of hard work and dedication in cricket.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah set to miss Champions Trophy group stage matches because of back swelling - The Indian Express
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Set to Miss Champions Trophy Group Stage Matches Due to Back Swelling

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah is expected to miss the group stage of the upcoming Champions Trophy due to swelling in his back. He will be undergoing monitoring at the National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru.

  • Bumrah has been advised to report to the National Cricket Academy for recovery monitoring.
  • The Champions Trophy starts on February 19, with matches in Karachi, Rawalpindi, Lahore, and Dubai.
  • Selectors are contemplating whether to include him in the main squad or as a reserve player.
  • Bumrah’s rehabilitation is expected to last for three weeks, and he should be match-fit by the first week of March.
  • His participation in the last group match against New Zealand on March 2 remains uncertain.
  • Bumrah has experienced back issues previously and missed 11 months of cricket due to surgery.
“He (Bumrah) will be going to NCA for his rehabilitation. The initial report says he doesn’t have a fracture but has swelling on his back.”

The Indian team management is cautious about Bumrah's workload, with his health being a priority for the team's performance in the upcoming tournament.

item.title: Devajit Saikia elected as BCCI secretary, Prabhtej Singh Bhatia is treasurer - The Hindu
item.description:
Devajit Saikia Elected as BCCI Secretary, Prabhtej Singh Bhatia Takes Role of Treasurer

Published on: January 12, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Devajit Saikia and Prabhtej Singh Bhatia were elected unopposed as secretary and treasurer of the BCCI during a Special General Meeting held on January 12, 2025.

  • Saikia, the incumbent joint-secretary, and Bhatia were the only candidates for their positions.
  • The election was formalized without the need for a vote due to their uncontested status.
  • The positions became vacant due to the resignations of Jay Shah and Ashish Shelar.
  • An election for the joint-secretary's post is expected within the next 45 days.
  • Saikia has been influential in Assam cricket since 2016 and developed the Barsapara Cricket Stadium.
  • Bhatia has experience in BCCI administration and comes from a family with a rich background in cricket governance.
“Saikia has to strike a delicate balance along with national selectors regarding India’s men’s team’s transition.”

The election of Saikia and Bhatia marks a new chapter for BCCI, especially as they prepare for upcoming challenges in Indian cricket governance.

item.title: SA20 2025: Match 5, PC vs DSG Match Prediction – Who will win today’s SA20 match between JSK vs MICT? - CricTracker
item.description:
SA20 2025: Match 5, PC vs DSG Match Prediction

Date & Source: Sunday, January 12, 2025 - CricTracker

The upcoming match between Pretoria Capitals and Durban's Super Giants promises to be an electrifying contest, following a previous narrow defeat for the Capitals.

  • Match Details: Pretoria Capitals vs Durban's Super Giants
  • Venue: SuperSport Park, Centurion
  • Live Broadcast: Star Sports, Sports18 Network, Disney+ Hotstar

Key Points:

  • The last match between these two teams was a close contest, with the Capitals losing by just two runs.
  • The pitch at Centurion is expected to favor batters, making a high-scoring match likely.
  • Head-to-Head record: Played 5, Pretoria Capitals won 2, Durban's Super Giants won 3.
  • Predicted top performers include Will Jacks as the best batter and Noor Ahmad as the best bowler.
Today's Match Prediction: Team bowling first to win the match.

In conclusion, this match is set to be intense, with both teams vying for an important victory early in the tournament.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Wants To 'Remain India Captain For Few More Months', Will Quit After... - News18
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Wants To 'Remain India Captain For Few More Months', Will Quit After...

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: News18

Indian men’s cricket team captain Rohit Sharma has expressed his desire to remain captain for a few more months while a search for his successor begins.

  • Rohit Sharma opted out of the fifth Test against Australia and met with BCCI officials during a review meeting.
  • The 37-year-old led India to a T20 World Cup win in 2024 and seeks to continue in his role as captain.
  • Jasprit Bumrah has been proposed as a long-term successor, though there are concerns about his fitness due to a back injury.
  • Rohit is set to lead India in the ICC Champions Trophy, starting on February 19, 2025.
  • The decision regarding India's next captain may be made during the IPL 2025 season.
“I have requested the board to find a new captain while I continue to lead.”

The meeting also highlighted the importance of players participating in domestic cricket, subject to coach and physio approvals.

item.title: England tour of India 2025: IND vs ENG complete schedule, full squads and live streaming details - Mint
item.description:
England Tour of India 2025: Complete Schedule and Details

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Live Mint

India is set to host England for a series of T20Is and ODIs as they prepare for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Key Points

  • India will play five T20Is and three ODIs against England beginning January 22, 2025.
  • The first T20I is scheduled in Kolkata, followed by matches in Chennai, Rajkot, Pune, and Mumbai.
  • ODI matches will take place in Nagpur, Cuttack, and Ahmedabad.
  • Star Sports will broadcast all matches live, with streaming available on Disney-plus Hotstar.
  • Ticket booking can be done through the District app by Zomato and at various venues.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

India and England have faced off in 52 ODIs in India, with India winning 34 and England 17, with one tie.

This series serves as significant preparation for both teams ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy.

item.title: Rare moment of praise: Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh lauds MS Dhoni! - The Times of India
item.description:
Yograj Singh Commends MS Dhoni in Rare Moment of Praise

Publication Date: October 10, 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a rare instance, Yograj Singh, the father of renowned cricketer Yuvraj Singh, has publicly praised MS Dhoni, lauding his contributions to Indian cricket.

  • Yograj Singh expressed his admiration for Dhoni's leadership.
  • The comment comes amid discussions about the evolving dynamics of Indian cricket.
  • Dhoni's influence and legacy in cricket are acknowledged by many former players.
“Dhoni is a legend who has transformed the game.” - Yograj Singh

This acknowledgment from Yograj Singh highlights the respect and recognition that Dhoni continues to command in the cricketing community.

item.title: Manoj Tiwary clarifies brutal 'hypocrite' assessment of Gautam Gambhir: 'I have no need to follow the tide' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Manoj Tiwary Clarifies 'Hypocrite' Comment on Gautam Gambhir

Date: Jan 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

After calling Gautam Gambhir a 'hypocrite', Manoj Tiwary takes to social media to explain his comments following India's loss against Australia. He expresses regret for being misunderstood and emphasizes his impartial stance.

  • Manoj Tiwary labelled Gautam Gambhir a 'hypocrite' over the selection of players in the Indian team.
  • Tiwary criticized Gambhir's role in KKR's IPL title win, attributing the success to team effort rather than Gambhir's individual contribution.
  • He faced backlash and clarified his statements in a video, emphasizing he did not intend to follow others' criticisms.
“I have no need to wash my hands in the flowing Ganga.” - Manoj Tiwary

This incident has sparked significant conversation within the cricketing community about accountability and recognition in team sports.

item.title: ILT20 Opening Ceremony: Shoaib Akhtar and Harbhajan Singh catch up with Shahid Kapoor, video goes viral - Mint
item.description:
Shoaib Akhtar and Shahid Kapoor Reunite at ILT20 Opening Ceremony

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: Live Mint

Former Pakistan cricketer Shoaib Akhtar met Bollywood actor Shahid Kapoor during the ILT20 tournament in UAE, and the interaction was shared widely on social media.

The video features a background song from Shahid's movie Kabir Singh, showcasing a cordial conversation between the actors. Akhtar expressed delight at the meeting on Instagram.

  • Shoaib Akhtar and Harbhajan Singh were present at the ILT20 opening ceremony.
  • Shahid Kapoor performed with the cast of his upcoming film 'Deva'.
  • Videos of their interaction went viral on social media, garnering positive reactions.
“Lovely running into @shahidkapoor at @ilt20official.” - Shoaib Akhtar

The friendly exchange highlights the intersection of sports and entertainment, captivating fans from both fields.

item.title: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli travel to Alibaug from Mumbai, chat as they wait for boat. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli Travel to Alibaug from Mumbai

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Anushka Sharma and cricketer Virat Kohli were seen traveling from Mumbai to Alibaug, sharing a conversation while waiting for their boat.

  • Anushka wore a white T-shirt, a striped blue shirt, black shorts, and red shoes.
  • Virat donned a black outfit with a white cap and shoes.
  • Several videos and pictures of their outing circulated on social media.
  • The couple recently visited spiritual leader Premanand Maharaj with their children.
  • They have been noted for attending various spiritual events together.
“Last time we came, I had some questions in my mind... I would like to ask you to give us prem-bhakti (divine love).” - Anushka Sharma

This outing brought the couple into the spotlight again, following their recent visits to spiritual leaders with their family.
